page.title: 04DRAINAGE ON MARK MOOR
page.content: Rhyne system comprises a framework of drainage maintained by Local Drainage Boards. Farmers are responsible for ditches feeding into the framework. The rhynes run into rivers maintained by River Boards. The cost is met by a levy on all owners of property. Water Table is very high & the whole area is below sealevel. Field Drainage formerly by surface gripes, nowadays by below surface clay or polythene pipes, the cost of which is assisted by Government grants. Wetlands in the circumstances of extreme rain the water is lifted by pumping stations into the river. The drainage is assisted by the excavation of the New Huntspill River during 1939-45 to provide water for the Ordnance Factory at Puriton.
